Hi all,

I'm trying to test a UI application. I'm using JUnit with NetBeans=
 4.1
and Ant 3.8.1.

I have contents in one test method like this:
- - - - =

//fail("place 1");
try {
    javax.swing.SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait (new=
 Runnable () {
        public void run () {
             // do some UI test=
ing
        }
    });
} catch (Exception e) {
    fail(e.toString());
}

Sy=
stem.out.println("Foobar!");
System.out.flush();
fail("place 2");
- - - - 
=

When I look at the Ant build log, I DO see the output "Foobar!", but
nothi=
ng about the test failure. If I uncomment the line fail("place
1"); then th=
e Ant build will fail normally.

So the question is, why does the test's po=
ssibility to fail properly
get disabled from doing some stuff in between? 
=

(Actually, it doesn't get completely disabled. The test execution
would st=
op when fail() gets executed, but nothing is reported about
the failure.)

=
This is really annoying, and I can't find anything like this from FAQs
on b=
y googling. Any help would be much appreciated.

Thanks,
Vesa
